13 // These directives are used for determining what platform this code is being
14 // compiled for. While it may look at little strange that they are initially
15 // defined and then undefined again if they are not valid: this is done solely
16 // so correct Doxygen docs can be built for the preprocessor no matter what
17 // platform Doxygen is running from.

84 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_CONSTRUCTION( type_name ) \
85  type_name() = delete; \
86  type_name( const type_name& ) = delete; \
87  void operator=( const type_name& ) = delete
88 
99 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN( type_name ) \
100  type_name( const type_name& ) = delete; \
101  void operator=( const type_name& ) = delete

110 #define CHAOS_FOR_EACH( it, collection ) \
111  auto it = collection.begin(); \
112  for ( ; it != collection.end(); ++it )
113 
119 #define CHAOS_PRINT_ITERABLE( collection ) \
120  auto it = collection.begin(); \
121  std::cout << "[ "; \
122  for ( ; it != collection.end(); ++it ) \
123  { \
124  std::cout << *it << ", "; \
125  } \
126  std::cout << "]" << std::endl
